revisionDesc.change: Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - The lines of the recto and l. 26 are not displayed in the preview. In ll. 5, 11 and 12, write only τὸ<ν> and τὰ<ς>, without the tag |reg|

Submit - Updated some points in the transcription: - l. 1 added markup for centered line (see picture and ed.pr.) - l. 14 added initial vacat and asterisk, after picture and ed.pr. - l. 15 added information about tachygraphic lines, after picture and ed.pr. - l. 26 updated information after Kopidakis, ZPE 25 (1977), 53. The writing exercise is encoded in the DCLP under TM 61402. Interconnecting somehow the two records might be taken into consideration. - div tags: switched recto/verso according to observations by Valeria Piano against the pictures of the papyrus: she noted that the main body of the letter is very likely written on the recto against the fibres (i.e. transversa charta).
